name: St Honore Pastries
cuisine: Restaurants, Food, Bubble Tea, Coffee & Tea, Bakeries

reviews.comment:
The crispy roast pork is SO GOOD and lowkey it's 2 little buns stack next to each other for the price of 1. Amazing amazing and can't recommend enough.

When I got there ~2 pm the bun I got was warm!

The owners do a great job with this place. It is clean, well lit and managed well. They are always friendly and helpful. Bought some great mooncakes for the Mid Autumn Fest and were reasonably priced. My 2 favs are their butter buns and steamed buns - best in Chinatown. Also they have a good selection of cakes, buns and cookies. You gotta try their custard cakes. There are like 8 or 9 bakeries in Chinatown. This one is at the top of my list.

name: Sonic Drive-In
cuisine: Burgers, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Restaurants

reviews.comment: If you guys close at 11 on a weekend.  Maybe you should change the hours on here to the correct ones.  Got there at 11:30pm and she tells me there no longer taking orders. But then turns around and takes another cars order.  Will be calling a manager in the morning Bc they didn't answer my call tonight.

Not really sure about this location. I use to come here as a kid and I just ordered a root beer... that's it.... took about 15 minutes for them to take my order... and 10 minutes to bring it out..... not sure how you get a cherry coke confused with root beer... but I'm so thirsty I'll drink it anyway... no telling how a food order would go, so I won't chance it. Ima go next door to the gas station to get a root beer now.

name: Tsevi's Pub And Grill
cuisine: Pubs, Restaurants, Italian, Bars, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Greek

reviews.comment: After about 7 minutes of waiting patiently for any form of life to serve us, a chef came out and asked if we had been served. He sent over a waitress. My boyfriend claims his Budweiser didn't taste right and his salad had a slight brown tint to it and barely any green. He got a steak and broccoli. The steak was tiny and shitty, but the broccoli was perfecto. I got a half burnt salmon/ bacon wrap. Then I went to the bathroom and felt like I was peeing outside in the -4 degree weather. Went back to the table and waited for the waitress for bout 5 mins then took her the credit card. I explained to the manager how cold it is in the women's bathroom. He said, " would you like me to bring in the fire pit from outside and light a fire for you?" While laughing at his own joke another worker sitting next to him said, " it's the same in the men's bathroom , my dick shrivels up every time I go in there." This place must be a drug front.
FYI, this restaurant is now closed. Forrey's restaurant now occupies the space. It has steak, seafood, pizza and other items.

name: Sonic Drive-In
cuisine: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Fast Food, Burgers, Restaurants, Food

reviews.comment: This is the worst sonic I ever been to. They seem to be frequently out of items, it's a 50/50 chance the food will cold by the time you get it and forget trying talk directly to them, they will more than likely not be so friendly. Despite this, its convenient so I keep going back. Today topped the cake. I sat there for 15 mins... Only for them to turn it off my little red button off in stall number 10 without ever taking my order. I am now at Krystals up the street trying to salvage what's left of my lunch break. I think I'm done trying here. Lol.
I've hated on this sonic location before, but to be fair, I actually had quick and very friendly service this time. Maybe they it's a fluke, or maybe they have changed things for the better. Good job

I have traveled to Vietnam several times, love the countries food.  Nothing is more disappointing to me than going to a Vietnamese restaurant in the US snd order pho and it either has no flavor, to much grease, or the nasty after taste of msg. That is NOT the case here. The pho broth is so aromatic and many levels of flavor you want to drink the whole bowl.  That's not all! The egg rolls are so crispy and flavorful, easily can tell they are hand made and fresh.  Great food snd service, if they had a restaurant it would crush the others in Tampa Bay.  
Somebody give these folks some recognition for their pho!!

Vietnamese Food Truck was a super perfect dinner for me tonight! I saw they were in the nearby neighborhood today, & I immediately went online to order.

Since it is a chilly winter night, I knew that Pho was perfect for me. I ordered the beef and meatball pho and it was a great amount of meat to noodle ratio. It was super tasty. 

I also ordered the bbq Pork banh mi. It had tons of flavor with it and the bread was a nice texture, not too hard and still nicely toasted.

Lastly, I ordered the Vietnamese wings with fries. The flavor is good for the wings and the fries were okay, they are the skinny ones. That was my husband's order.

When I ordered it online I received an update through text of when it would be finished and I drove across the street to get it. So super simple and convenient. 

I'm super happy to have their leftovers tomorrow!! So so good.

Thanks for coming out to the area! So nice not to go far and leave the neighborhood!

I was sat with in a few minutes of arriving. My waitress, Anita, came by and took my beverage order in a very timely manner. I see a slew of really recent negative reviews. I had absolutely no issues with either service or food quality or the speed and accuracy of my Slam. I don't get to this Denny's often, but I rather enjoyed the causal ambiance.  Not exactly a diner, yet comfortable and fast. As for my breakfast, I made a slam of scrambled eggs, white toast, bacon and sausage. Every tasted very good. I really liked the thin, crispy bacon which was crunchy and not smoky. The thick ceramic mug really held the heat of the coffee which was served piping hot.

If you want bad service and an assistant manager who does not care, go to Dennys on US 31 South. The young lady who served us didn't care one way or another if you were there or not, and trying to tell the assistant manager, well let's just say she doesn't care either. Never going back.

I'm extremely sad that this place is closed, this place was the best after eating subs from here I can never eat a sub from subway or any of the other chain restaurants ever again. Really wish this place would re-open.
Please re-open. I am lost without you. The Italian is the light of my life. I feel like I've been dumped.
We are big fans of Tuna Bar, especially for a quick and quiet weekend lunch. Their fish tastes super fresh and their sushi rolls are amazing.

Highlights: all the cocktails were delicious! Lychee martini and norigrets were faves. Honestly everything was delicious but top items worth trying were the tuna crudo, wonton Soup and rittenhouse roll. They were definitely the most unique. But I don't think you could go wrong with any of the rolls or fish here. Very fresh and great presentation. 

Atmosphere is super trendy, great for a date or meeting friends for happy hour! Also has cute outdoor seating with heating. Will definitely be back!
Great place with incredible genuine food and a hard working man running the place. I highly recommend coming here for the best Korean food and supporting this family.
Love this place. Great food, exceptional service, clean little restaurant. I can't recommend it highly enough

name: Roast Coffeehouse and Wine Bar
cuisine: Coffee & Tea, Food, Cafes, Bars, Wine Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

reviews.comment: I was surprised to hear that this place had closed. Too cool for Edmonton. It's also a difficult balance for a cafe between making a place feel cosy enough to spend hours there, and having people actually buy 1 drink and spending hours there.

Delicious coffee, great service, wonderful atmosphere.
Best soy vanilla latte in town. I don't care how much it costs, it's the best.  But don't you worry, the prices are similar to those of other coffee joints in Edmonton.
I love this restaurant it is the best and you can't beat the price !!! My favorite is hibachi chicken and shrimp !!
The food here is actually pretty good, but the location seems a little weird.    It really feels lime a mall food court place that was transported to a seedy strip mall.

I've ordered takeout twice from here in the past few months. The first time I called, I placed my order with a woman. After I read my order, she asked if there'd be anything else, I said it would be all, then she hung up on me. Hmm.. weird, I thought. So I go in to pick up my order, which (my fault) I didn't double check, and come home to find multiple items missing. I call back to make sure I wasn't charged, since I didn't receive an itemized receipt, and the same lady answers. "Okay well I didn't hear you," she says after I explained the situation, and hangs up on me...AGAIN. Thankfully I wasn't charged. So, I figure, she had a bad night, whatever. 

So then last night, I decide to order takeout again. I recognize the woman's voice immediately, so I go ahead and place my order, once again she gives me the total, I say okay, she hangs up on me without reading back the order or telling me how long it'll be. So I call back asking how long it'll be, "I don't know, 20 minutes?" HANGS UP. At this point I'm wondering if I even go pick up the food, but I think to myself whatever, the Mac is good. So I go down to pick up my food, and a woman brings it out to me. Low and behold, it's the same woman that on the phone, AND she's the manager! I felt less crazy after reading the other reviews, it seems her attitude and knack for being unprofessional is a normal thing. Good pasta, doesn't make up for the bad service.

I had the most lovely time at the Macaroni Grill because of our wonderful server he was a tall young gentlemen with blonde hair. However it was obvious to me that the older female manager named Trena was terrible toward her employees and guests, I have never seen such terrible management! Although I thought it was a pleasant time due to our service, the management will never make me come back ever again! The gentlemen in the suit walks around like he owns the place aswell! Terrible!

This place has since moved to Madison Square Shopping Center just down the road from the old location.  They are now located on the left back corner across from The National College of Business and Technology.  Same great food with great prices to match.  I did notice that they now accept credit cards!
Great hot dogs very divey atmosphere.  Good quick simple meal.

This was our final dinner in Nashville.  We didn't have this one planned out, rather looked at online reviews for nice Asian because we had already had so much heavy, fried cuisine.  This place was a gem!

I called ahead for a reservation but they were booked up for most of the night.   I was told we could sit at the bar and it would be best to come early.   We actually arrived before their dinner hours began, so we sat at the bar and ordered from their small plates.  

Mike was very friendly, helpful, and welcoming.  He concocted a great non-alcoholic drink for me, which I ordered a few of over the course of our meal!   I can't remember exactly what it was, I believe it was made of cranberry juice, soda water, and a generous sprig of rosemary (picture attached).

We started with the edamame, yaki gyoza (pheasant dumplings), tuna tartare, and lobster shumai (lobster and corn dumplings).  Everything was nicely plated and tasted wonderful.

Next up were the famed spicy crab noodles.  Upon arrival of this dish, we quickly realized: a) that it was so good that we had to order another, b) that it was so good that my spouse was going to eat it all so we had to order another, and c) that it was so good that I wasn't going to want to share the dish with my spouse, so we had to order another!  So, we immediately ordered another!   

Also--interesting find--the toilet seats were heated!  

This is a very unique establishment and we were glad to have the opportunity to visit it!   We were happy to find such a friendly place with fresh ingredients and very unique selections for our last big meal in Nashville!

It's rare to have a perfect experience at even the best restaurants but that exactly what we had last night.  Service was effective. The restaurant was comfortable and interesting.  The food was outstanding.  Lobster shomai was so memorable.  The wagyu beef was perfectly cooked and presented and the spicy crab noodles were equally great.  We are from Atlanta so can't get back anytime soon but we will be there again at some point.  It's worth the trip!

name: Bar One
cuisine: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

reviews.comment: Short rib potato skins and eggplant stack are awesome. Playlist of music in the bar thanks to Chris et. al is great. Atmosphere is fun and friendly and loud on week, but quieter on weeknights. Just as friendly and pleasant.

I recently went to Bar One for  my second time which was as good as the first. The first time I had the short rib potato skins which were to die for and the second time the flat bread. Well I have to say the food is second behind the great bartender Mike. He was working his butt off and still trying to give everyone the attention they deserved. I will be back!

So this is the pizza joint my son and I hit up. Here's what  they do right, they make the pizza per instructions listed in all Domino's. They get your order right consistently. They have a drive thru so I don't have to get Covid. I feel like Kevin from Home Alone when I come here because I'm always getting a cheese pizza, but the cheesy bread dipped into some marinara is also dope. If you've seen my other posts, you know that the wife and daughter are GF, don't do this option here they can't comprehend cross contamination, and I don't expect the teenagers here to either, BDP! (If you know you know), save GF option for Molipazzo. Domino's keep being you and I'll keep patronizing your fine establishment.
Ordered the 5.99 deals tonight. I was able to feed the family on only $30. Great delivery time & great food! Thank you!

Ordered for the first time a few weeks ago.  I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and how delicious it was.  I ordered a pasta dish and the mozzarella sticks.  Both were hot when they arrived, the delivery driver was friendly and everything was in tact.  The mozzarella sticks did have a thick batter, but it states that on the menu.  I was sad when I found out they were closed on Sunday.  We have been ordering from Mimmo's Pizza for our pasta and while it is "ok" we were pleased to know that now can order for DeSandro on Main and enjoy quality fresh food.  Thanks!
This place is the most convenient and delicious spot in the area!! Wide variety of pizzas, wings and fries and they're open until very late hours. The best place to be in Manayunk.

Placed a delivery order on a Saying night, very understanding that it is a busy night and not expecting it to arrive immediately. When we did receive our pizza we received a reheated frozen pizza! We have ordered from them before and we know what their pizza looks like and this was not it ! Was not even able to eat the pizza because it was so awful.

The pizza is fine but their new app to order it is terrible. Apps are supposed to make things easy. Their new app makes it impossible to simply order a pizza. When I finally got to the order screen there were a total of four extra fees. No thanks.

name: Craft Hall
cuisine: Eatertainment, Arts & Entertainment, Brewpubs, American (Traditional), Bakeries, Breweries, Food, Restaurants

reviews.comment:
I haven't been in this building since it was Yard's and ended up here for the first time after a Mad Hatter's Gin & Tea Party last week. 
There was a nice selection of beer and great food menu. It was a busy Friday night but the staff was friendly, our food came out quick and the fries were hot. 
Fun place and great location. We'll definitely be back.

We usually come here on a thursday late afternoon when the crowd volume is just right. We came this past sunday and it was PACKED. Firstly, I had no idea they offered an AYCE buffet brunch for $40 including wine, beer, and some specialty drinks. That's not a bad deal. I didn't opt for the buffet  brunch because I wasn't that hungry, 

I wound up getting the burger and fries combo which is always pretty good here. Mind you I just said I wasn't that hungry and barely finished my food. My wife ordered the sauteed mushroom melt and hers was so big, we could have split that instead. 

Overall, I will definitely just stick to Thursday mostly because as much as I love the kids play area, I could see my daughter was overwhelmed by the amount of kids and didn't have as much fun which is half the reason we come, but that's nothing the business can control. Thursdays seem to be a sweet spot, but that brunch will definitely be explored one day soon!

A friend just told me the Exton place closed. I'm going to check this.
I drove by, parking lot is empty and one car backed up to the front door taking things out.. It's closed.

I really like the design of this place. Very tropical, very beachy which I love. You walk in and painted all over the walls is fish, and birds, and palm trees. Very beachy type drinks and food. Food is excellent I usually get some sort of fish. Very fresh and tasty. The amount of TVs help you keep up with sports if you need to, but if not it's just a nice place to go hang out for a little

name: Tony's Restaurant & 3rd Street Cafe
cuisine: Restaurants, Specialty Food, Steakhouses, Food, Italian, Pizza, Pasta Shops

reviews.comment:
Had a wonderful meal.  Our first time visiting the NEW location.  WELL Done!

Food was fantastic and Bro our waitress was extremely kind, attentive and knowledgeable.

Can't wait to come back for New Urars.

Ok - First the lady behind the bar was perfect.  Kind and professional.  I had French onion soup a tenderloin kabob and some pasta with scallops.  The French onion soup... it had a piece of processed white cheese on top..... wtf!!!  I would expect this at McDonald's  or Taco Bell if they had it....   ok the kabob.  It was cold!!
The scallops way over cooked.  Honestly, I have never had exceptional service there. Always slow. And now that I have thought about it.  The owners need to spend more time there. My dinner tonight was pathetic. I am done with this place. Too many chances and too many let downs.

My husband and I stopped by the restaurant a few weeks ago to pick up dinner for our son and ourselves. The next day, my son was hungry and I told him he could have my leftover chicken fried rice. He tipped it into a bowl and mixed up in the food was a blue rubber band. Needless to say he didn't eat the food. I told him to send the restaurant an E-mail which he did. He received no response. I then sent an E-mail. It's now 3 weeks after our purchase and we have heard nothing. Clearly they don't care about customer service so we will not be going back.

not many chinese restaurants in area
love their buffet
cant eat buffets more than once a month

name: Caviar & Bananas
cuisine: Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Wine Bars, Bars, Nightlife, American (Traditional), Event Planning & Services, Food, Caterers, Breakfast & Brunch, Cafes, Diners

reviews.comment:
ok this place is really weird the exterior is super pretty and it gives off rich person brunch vibes but it is essentially a cafeteria??? there is a salad bar, a deli area, a bakery, and then you can buy chips, drinks, etc at a cash register. i got the buffalo chicken salad--it was pretty mediocre. the lettuce and chicken was good but the dressing was super bland and there was way too much cabbage. this is a place to grab a salad or something on your way to your job, don't expect a brunch place or sit down restaraunt really--I thought it was just a cafeteria for Vanderbilt at first.

FOOD: 3/5
SERVICE: 5/5
ATMOSPHERE: 3/5

I have tried to give Caviar and Bananas the benefit of the doubt because it's so convenient and the inside is really cute. But the food is so subpar and highly overpriced for what you get. The service really isn't bad in terms of the employees they are usually friendly but god is the food terrible. Picture of my "sweet potato and kale hash".

We haven't eaten there in person, but we have bought their chicken parm family dinners as takeout several times. It comes with six chicken cutlets sitting on top of pasta, salad and bread for $60. 

It's tasty and since it's intended to feed up to six people, we always get at least two dinners for the three of us, and usually one or two of us also get a lunch. 

My only complaint is that it's apparently aimed at families where only one or two people (the adults?) actually want to eat salad. We can barely stretch it to three. 

It's in the neighborhood and will definitely keep it in our takeout rotation.

This was our first time at Core de Roma. There's a parking lot in the back. It's BYOB which I didn't realize when I made the reservation. We had a table for 4 at 6:30pm. The restaurant filled up quickly. We didn't order any appetizers. They did bring us a basket of warm, delicious bread and a small plate of beans in olive oil. Our meals came out quickly. We had veal parmigiana, fettuccine Alfredo, lasagna, and gnocchi. Everything was delicious. Our server was hustling around the whole time. There only seemed to be 3 servers for a large dining room. I would definitely recommend Core de Roma and would go there again.

name: Paws The Cat Cafe
cuisine: Coffee & Tea, Cafes, Pets, Restaurants, Pet Adoption, Food

reviews.comment:
What a lovely place!
I found it by accident having visited the camera store across the street. The cats a very friendly and chatty and all different personalities. Oh and the coffee was nice too :-)

I will echo what I said during my review of The Cat Cafe on Whyte and point out that it is nearly impossible not to give 5 stars to a place that helps find homeless fur babies loving families.

The admission is a few dollars cheaper than the one on Whyte but your also only getting one drink here as opposed to as many as you can drink during your visit. The drinks here are great though. The chai latte I had was far better than the watered down junk I used to get at Starbucks and who would really expect a high quality drink from a place where the drinks are not the main focus? It was a great surprise!

The cat room is really cute and homey although admittedly a bit small. My friend and I were the only customers for the hour that we were there though and it was so nice being able to love on all the cats and not have to deal with a horde of other patrons attempting to get their attention. I think the staff love on them quite a bit as well. All the kitties we visited with seemed very well socialized and not at all skittish.

All in all it was an awesome time and I hope to visit and have many more here at Paws.

The service was great and the place was huge and pristine.  I can't figure out how I came at the peak lunch hour and there were more people in line at the cleaners next door!! I was the only person in here for the better part of 30 minutes.  The food was just ok...on the bland side.  Food alone, 1.5 stars...the service improved the score.
Excellent! Loved the food and the kids loved the play area! Not very busy but that is better news for us! Everything is home made! Really yummy!
They sadly closed today at 4pm. Rip to Tampa's best ny style pizza. Hopefully someone can take the recipes and open a new spot

This pizza is greasy, cheesy, and saucy... And it's perfect that way! This is a must go to pizza spot in Tampa, one of the top five for sure. The wait time has always been reasonable, and if you arrive early they always have a game on. 

I highly recommend the cheese pizza!

I honestly would never thought that a place located in this area would serve good food. The fried cat fish taste just like the fish you would eat at a cookout. It is fried to your liking. The Jambalaya is cooked how the vendors at the French Quarter Fest and the Jazz Fest cooked theirs. It is so delicious to say your mom or uncle did not cook it. There is always a table available so you hardly have to wait. The to go orders are always hot and ready like Little Caesars. The managers are always on the floor greeting each customers. There is a special each day. The hours isn't early bird friendly, but it'll do if you ever want to meet a few friends and family there. Stop by and ask for Sydney, she is a great waitress.

I am never patronizing this business again! My husband and I ordered oysters (Oyster Rockefeller/Raw) Wednesday night. I complained my Oyster Rockefeller tasted burned but received no reimbursement for my order. Thursday morning my husband and I had a severe case of food poisoning at which time I emailed the director of Lafittes Landing  (advising her of a possible bad batch of oysters served to us the previous evening)due to our food poisoning. I received a response of "thanks,I will investigate". I was never offered any compensation,apologized to or offered a complimentary meal/reimbursement for our previous meal. This is not the proper way to run a business.

name: Twin Peaks
cuisine: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

reviews.comment: Been wanting to come to twin peaks for a while. The food was great, and the service, FROM VICTORIA was amazing. Everhing was as I asked for and Victoria's personality was great.....definatly gonna be back
Thank you to our server Kate . Couldn't ask for a better person very sweet , kind and a good listener

name: Village Tap Room
cuisine: Gastropubs, Cocktail Bars, Beer Bar, Bars, Restaurants, Nightlife

reviews.comment:
I went here numerous times as Chumley's, but this was my first visit as the village tap room. Summary: go for the Thursday night 1/2 off scooner drink special, don't eat the food. 

The beer special is decent with a fairly good selection. The beers are expensive straight up ($6-8), but you can drink a scooner of craft beer (32 oz) for $5. 

This last visit I didn't eat my meal. I ordered the steak burger medium with chipotle salsa (I was experimenting). The steak burger was well done as was my friend who also ordered medium. The buns were the cheap, wonderbread, kind you get in the 12-pack for a block party bbq. The chipotle salsa appeared to just be some salsa from a common brand container. This all cost me $9, which was ridiculous. 

The restaurant was pretty much empty, but I'm not that surprised. Come here for the drink special before it goes out of business!

The margarita tasted like lemonade. It was AWFUL and tasted like it had no tequila in it at all. I asked to either switch it out for something else or for them to remake it and they wouldn't do either. I won't ever be back! Terrible service.

name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
cuisine: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

reviews.comment: Went with a friend this past weekend and I must say it was a pretty horrible experience. The waitress was terrific but the food was horrible. The calamari app was rubbery, the sauce on top tasted like mayo with spice added. Worse yet was the North Bake, the king crab legs were beyond over done. Definitely not fresh m. Never going again.

Though not my first time there, eating at the bar was a first.   It was surprisingly quiet for a Saturday night especially with a local team playing in the Final Four!  Soured by the fact that they wouldn't put the volume up on the game (at all!), our moods changed once receiving a spot on beer recommendation for my finicky beer drinking friend. Our meals arrived in a timely manner.  An Old Bay burger for my friend and the Grilled Seafood Cobb Salad for me.  What a pleasant surprise!  Aside from the very odd and unnecessary crumbled  blue cheese (which I nixed ), this was one of the best salads I've ever had.  The seafood was grilled and seasoned perfectly (scallops, shrimp and salmon) and a healthy portion of chilled crabmeat also made an appearance.   The greens were fresh and crisp and accompanied by ripe grape tomatoes, hard boilled egg, avacado  and lemon parmesan dressing which I got on the side.  I also asked for a lemon which I squeezed generously over the whole salad.  Bright and outrageously flavorful...I will make a point to get there again soon for that same dish.

name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
cuisine: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

reviews.comment: The divey-ist of dive bars. Terrible music, unfriendly service (heard our server go on multiple aggressive rants to herself), overall sad crowd. I'm also not sure how the attached picture qualifies as a receipt.

Walked in around 12:45 because they are open until 3 am. Excited to get a drink or two in, until they refused my passport. Their policy is that they "can't accept passports". A bar/restaurant are supposed to accept them and I was shocked that they didn't.  I've been using my passport to get into places for months. So I showed my i'd, which was expired, but that's the reason why I used my passport. They couldn't accept that either. There were about 5 people in the place. Take the business, it wouldn't hurt.

name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
cuisine: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

reviews.comment: Great water pressure with the sinks in the bathrooms . Great amount of soap dispense in one pump. Felt very satisfied

We are staying near the airport and we went out for some supplies and goggle nearby restaurant and found 39 North Taproom & Grill . The food and drinks was great But the STAFF was Better !! We would eat her again when in the area...

So sad to see the restaurant leave the northwest side at their Foothills Mall location. It was not the most authentic Italian food in town but I had never had a bad meal there. I absolutely loved the seafood manicotti and many other dishes from the menu. It always tasted fresh and very homemade.

Plus, my husband and I got engaged there. Not the most romantic ambiance some might say but it was perfect for us. 

Good bye Gavi, you will be missed.

This was a 2nd choice as our first choice in Tucson proper was packed.

I had the spaghetti with meat sauce which was pretty decent. It was a homemade sauce with lots of meat and even chunks of real tomatoes in it. The sauce was not sickeningly sweet and actually tasted pretty decent.

The bread was fresh on the table and the cold antipasti was excellent. Salads were fresh and not from a bag and the dressings were decent.

A loud atmosphere inside and the crowding of the tables inside would be the only downfall. Also, they sat a party of four at a table that at most could fit 2 comfortably.

Service was decent, but not exceptional. There were times our table of four was ignored but drinks seemed to be refilled on a regular basis. Hostess staff was not impressive and seemed to be bored or uninterested and seemed to spend most of the time flirting with the waiters as they ran their tickets next to the host staff.

From my two local Tucson natives, this location is better than the one on Broadway I believe.

I wanted this to be a 4* review but due to the few shortcomings it will have to remain at 3. Not good for groups due to the small, crammed together tables and relatively few booths.

Typical mall parking situation.

name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
cuisine: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

reviews.comment:
The food here is seriously good, and that's impressive because as a destination place they could easily cut corners.  Top notch ingredients and they must have a good chef. It's always packed and they have weekly specials and trivia.

It's very loud and mostly bar food but again the quality is there.  Service is as best as can be given the labor crisis which affects most small businesses in the country.  

Biggest negative is they make you give a credit card when ordering. even when seated at a table.  Never experienced that in my life at a restaurant but not a deal killer.  I do highly recommend trying this place out.  Bring a jacket because you're in an ice hockey place.

A hidden gem of the Chap. The wings are amazing and depending on the bartender you are in for a good drink. The food comes out prompt and hot and the customer service is always good. You can bring the family or pop in for a quick date night. Don't forget you can always skate the night away down stairs .

name: Wawa
cuisine: Restaurants, Automotive, Delis, Gas Stations, Food, Coffee & Tea, Sandwiches, Convenience Stores

reviews.comment: Was at the Penn Vet Hospital on a Sunday, limited food places that were convenient. Grabbed two custom hoagies, both shorti's ham and cheese, one with American, one Cheddar, lettuce tomato and Mayo. Easy enough? Not for the lazy sack making them. Cheddar on both, no Mayo on either. Not devastating but annoying for such an easy order. NE Philly Wawa's are much better!

My first time using Grub Hub via Yelp, to place an order for pickup.  The sandwich was made exactly has ordered and ready before the allotted time.  The staff was busy with many orders so I'm glad I cut line by ordering on-line!

name: Super Sushi Kyo Hin
cuisine: Restaurants, Japanese, Sushi Bars, Asian Fusion

reviews.comment: Good sushi and a nice staff. It does take a bit too long for the food to come out though.

It's hard to say how much I like the place because I base it on what I've had before and my favorites are in Central/North Jersey. I haven't found a great sushi place in South Jersey and I may or may not go back to this one because I'd like to try out a few other places.

The atmosphere is a little tacky, the music makes me feel like I want to fall asleep, but it seemed pretty clean. It took a little while for us to sit and order, there was only one girl working and one guy making the food. Nothing special on the service, not rude but not overly friendly.

Food was good. I didn't get sushi, I got the vegetable hibachi and my boyfriend got a few vegetarian rolls. He enjoyed the cucumber & avocado and sweet potato roll, the squash roll isn't the typical squash we were expecting so I don't think that was one he really liked. The hibachi was good- green peppers, onions, carrots, broccoli all mixed on a plate with sauce and a side of fried rice. A little plain. Soup and salad comes with it, salad was good, the clear soup-not as good as I was hoping, I didn't eat much of it, it tasted a little off.

Overall a decent place to eat. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but I won't kick and scream if I go back to eat.

name: Helena Avenue Bakery
cuisine: Food, Restaurants, Salad, Coffee & Tea, Breakfast & Brunch, Sandwiches, Bakeries

reviews.comment:
Loved the area & ambience, super cute. We only got to try one item but will be back for sure.
The Smoked Pastrami Reuben on Seeded Rye was delicious. It was a good portion & tasted really good. We split it. The mustard was a bit too much for me & burnt my nose. My husband loves meat and he said he wishes it had more meat it in. The side salad was very nice & refreshing, with great dressing.

This bakery is in a cool arts complex area with a few other restaurants and bars (we came to this same area for dinner the night before at The Lark). Very cool Santa Barbara feel. I had the Farmers Market sandwich (add ham) and he had the taco. We shared the amazing challah French toast (only avail on weekends). The baked egg sandwiches are huge. We loved the outside patio and it's of course dog friendly. 10/10 for us. The espresso
Machine was down which gave me the opportunity to walk to a coffee shop, Dart, down the street.

name: Copper Vine
cuisine: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

reviews.comment:
Seated on the back patio, we had heaters to warm us up on a cold winter night... I loved it! 

Anyways, drinks: beer selection is weak, but I went into this understanding this is a winepub so no need to dock points there. Additionally, I was still able to find a great beer to satisfy me. We also ordered two carafes of wine which was top tier.

The food! Bacon wrapped dates were incredible and rich, the burrata and eggplant caponata was bright and light and paired with some fantastic bread, the LA crawfish grilled cheese was also rich and quite tasty while paired with a side of Cajun carrots that were unique, truffle fries were your run of the mill truffle fry experience, and the cornflake chicken sandwich was uhhhhh bland and not seasoned and the only bad part of our meal.

Pros: our waitress (I wish I could remember her name), the decorations, music, outdoor patio, the burrata and eggplant caponata, wine selection, the zony mash sour beer I settled on

Cons: that poor chicken sandwich

Closing notes: absolutely will be back, as I already have a list of new menu items I want to try

Great atmosphere, but extremely overpriced and overhyped for the quality of the food. $17 wagyu burger, taste like regular ole angus beef. $29 for the black drum fish, my hubby said it was good but it oddly didn't come with a side. I got a regular margarita which was great while he got the "Gentle Sage," which was also good. Service was great, just sad that the food wasn't to my expectation.

name: Fresh Fruits & Salads
cuisine: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Fruits & Veggies, Salad, Specialty Food, Food

reviews.comment: Fresh fruits & salads has amazing salads and smoothies but make sure you order ahead of time. The owners are very old and move slowly so if you're running here on your lunch break like I was you won't have 40 minutes to wait. But, I did enjoy my food and smoothie ! The dream mix smoothie is amazing as well as creating your own salad with fresh toppings such as chick peas, eggs, tomatoes, peppers, ham, etc.

I eat here probably twice a week... I love that i can fax my order in and it be ready when I arrive because there is ALWAYS a rush! I don't stray from my usual so can't provide many options, but will say get you a soy surprise smoothie! Yummy!

name: Mike's Ice Cream
cuisine: Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Sandwiches, Food

reviews.comment:
The ice cream du jour downtown was busy but a tad understaffed, with only two people working. The one who served me got my ice cream, left me to wait at the register a bit to serve someone else, and then asked me how it was despite the fact that it was visibly untouched; she was a tad busy. I used to think understaffed businesses just had owners who were being cheap, but in the COVID era who knows.

I might have thought that my flavor choices of chocolate raspberry truffle and mint white chocolate oreo were unique, but I was bemused to read someone else's review where they ordered the same combination. These must be winning flavors. I actually liked the truffle even better than my mint chip but both were abundant in complexity. It was a mild winter day, but I did consider their large selection of specialty hot chocolates as well. They didn't seem to have much in the way of non-dairy frozen desserts, but their beverage selection offered multiple alternative milks so at least there's something if you need. I guess because they're open late downtown they see themselves as a bit of a convenience store as they had Tylenol and a few other random things for sale at the register.

It wasn't quite so good that I would rule out ever trying another dessert in Nashville, but their flavor selection is more than the basics and it is good.
The ice cream is great but the service is terrible. I was very surprised by how rude the staff was. I have been there a few times and every staff member was rude.

Nice job at the softball invitational this week folks!!! The wraps we got were outRageous and fresh ! I had the margarita with fresh basil  legit  cheese and fresh  my god team you rocked it.  My husband got the Hawaiian which was spectacular.   I didn't get them but dayum their basket of some crazy Parmesan fries was ginormous and looked amazing.   I'm a nice size and can eat but my gosh the wraps were huge!!! I forced it down because it was so good !!! I might stalk them now

I ate at the Impasto truck at the Viso Sunshop grand opening party and was impress-to by their food! 

The Itali-bano was a great take on a cuban, but with enough touches to make it unique(prosciutto cotto, deli pickles, and mustard aioli), though it was a tough decision to go with that over their many other offerings. Portion size was good as well, mine stretched into two meals along with the truffle fries which were crispy and golden, perfect amount of crunch.

I would highly recommend stopping by if you ever see them out and about or need a lunch option for an event!

name: Silver and Blue Outfitters
cuisine: Sporting Goods, Sports Wear, Fashion, Restaurants, Fast Food, Sandwiches, Shopping

reviews.comment:
Store has ok merchandise but the return policy is awful.  Girls working the counter seem to be more interested in FB and IG than helping customers.  I tried to return two hats without a receipt (after Christmas, wrong size) and was told no receipt, no return.  Took the lady's lip and showed up the next day with my receipt to only get store credit (because that's all they offer).  

I used the store credit to buy a shirt and some kids clothes so I wouldn't have to go back and I won't go back until they improve on their customer service and change the return policy.  

The return policy is and I quote, NO returns after 30 days, NO returns/exchanges without a receipt, NO CASH BACK, and you have to take the attitude that goes along with it all while the cashier updates their FB status.   

The no cash back part is a big sticking point, stand behind what you sell and don't hold your customers hostage by only giving store credit.

For any fan of the Wolf pack, the silver and blue outfitters is a must.
When you enter the store you are greeted by a doormat that says, no UNLV fans.
You pretty much can get anything wolf pack here.
It is like being in that store on main street in Disney land.
Key chains, pens, back packs, kids clothing, hats, T-shirts, polo shirts, jackets, jerseys, stickers, clocks, pictures, autographs, and aces merchandise.
I know I have left out many items, but you get the point. Need wolf pack gear, go to silver and blue.
They are locally owned, both guys that own the store went to Nevada.
Go Pack!!!
Love their chicken spiedini and beef spiedini lunch specials.  The house salad is so fresh and delicious.  Haven't tried their lunch buffet yet, but will be back. :)
neatest little family owned place around. I really enjoy their food. nice and quiet even when full and great staff

The food was excellent. We had a shrimp and crab boil that was delicious and plentiful. The sauce was so good. We had wonderful oysters and great sides. The service was also very good. My only complaint is that on a Saturday night they have music, not to my liking, that is too loud and distracting. Otherwise enjoyed it and will go back.

Ordered Togo more then once. 
Service as far as Togo's great. 
Overall good. 
I'd rather go to krab kingz Delmar as I've been doing. 
It's not worth the price you pay.

Friendly service and decent good food!
My family came in starving on new years eve and we left very happily satisfied. Food is good and service was on point! 
Our server, Cookie was so much fun and never disappointed!
Great experience overall!!

I really really wanted to like this place after the wonderful experience ordering and waiting for our take out.

The staff is fantastic!!!

The takeout food was the problem.

We ordered fried pickles, po boy, red beans and rice and crawfish etouffe.

The fried pickles was actually some of the best I've ever had.

The po boy was decent.

The rice was so under cooked it pretty much ruined the other dishes. On top of that there was maybe 1 crawfish in the etouffe. Was so disappointing!!! They even only give 2 of the smallest slices of bread with the etouffe..

Maybe the food is better when not takeout.
Do not let the location and old tables fool you!  Some of the most authentic and tasty Mexican food around. Three Yum Yums from me!
Best tacos hand made tortas got to get the steak is the best , comes with all the toppings on the side very good idea
